Author: toycrane#0000
Content:
This means that changes are about to begin to shake traditional financial markets from the ground up.

https://news.bitcoin.com/overstock-coms-t0-regulated-security-token-exchange/

Author: toycrane#0000
Content: The short selling market, which artificially moves stock prices and makes money, is an ecosystem in which financial companies, thousands of brokers and various pension fund foundations are intertwined. they are small, but they are strong enough to form a strong interest group. blockchain securities platform is the wall to cross.

Author: toycrane#0000
Content: It is important that the CEO, who is openly antipathetic to the U.S. financial industry, is working with regulators such as the SEC itself. The regulators are joining the project that could shake the foundation of the traditional financial industry. It is a change that was unlikely to be possible just a year ago.

Author: 1stormingj#0000
Content: Here's a well written and concise article on why running a full node is important and why 'mining nodes are the only nodes that matter' is wrong https://hackernoon.com/bitcoin-miners-beware-invalid-blocks-need-not-apply-51c293ee278b

Author: emmanux#0000
Content: important and not rewarded

Author: 1stormingj#0000
Content: Not with a measurable unit, but the removal of trust and ability to validate your money is it's own reward

Author: 1stormingj#0000
Content: And nodes not being rewarded for validating is a big concession from "non-mining nodes don't matter"

Author: emmanux#0000
Content: electrum servers could implement some little fee to maintain their service up, and clients could implement a validation of electrum servers to only work with those that have their p2p open to the world (full nodes).

Author: emmanux#0000
Content: win-win-win

Author: 1stormingj#0000
Content: Sure, but the cost of running a full node is so more or less free rendering such a service redundant

Author: 1stormingj#0000

Content: <@U66SWTM47> I suppose that depends on where you live and what kind of capacity you have, but I'm currently on copper cabling using a mediocre, below national average connection (admittedly in a first world country) and have no issues maintaining my node while also using and sharing the internet with several others

Content: And because bitcoin actually has a blocksize and peer limit, there's not expected growth in these variables, so it stands to reason it will continue to be more accessible in time

Content: money = energy. You need energy. But when you got enough energy does not mean you are 100% satisfied.

Author: passcombo.com#0000
Content: I got enough energy. I also tried everything in life waht was supposed to bring me happy. And it all failed üòõ

Author: passcombo.com#0000
Content: So my experience now is - not to waste energy on anything, just simply live peacefully.

Author: passcombo.com#0000
Content: Most things we do in ealry life is repeating what other people do - by assumption that if other get temporary satisfaction - we should also get it. Sometimes for some people it works. But not for all.

Author: passcombo.com#0000
Content: Only source of hope I found is following those guys who teach "no-mind" üôÇ , and claim they got full satisfaction in life. Some way it make sense  what they say (we all deeply identify with mind which is a tool for solving problems, not a tool for happiness), but it's more like a gift from life if you ever get 100% self-realisation, then sth you can achieve.

Author: l.ravel#0000
Content: How is it possible to have an idea of the amount of lost coins ?

Author: 1stormingj#0000
Content: There have been a couple of articles discussing the idea, it depends why you assume they're lost. Some estimations believe X% of coins that having moved in a certain period of time are statistically likely to be lost, there's a few hundred thousand believed to be owned by Satoshi that are 'lost', there are some quantities publicly acknowledged as lost and other known quantities that have been intentionally lost/destroyed/otherwise been made inaccessible

Content: Most recent study from November estimates 4m BTC lost
